title: How to Solve Simultaneous Equations Graphically

steps.title: Write your 2 equations clearly.
steps.content: Write your 2 equations clearly. Write your 2 equations in an organised, clear way. This will make it easier later. [2] X Research source In this guide, we are going to use equations 3x+4y=22 and x+2y=2 as an example.

steps.title: In the first equation, let x be 0.
steps.content: In the first equation, let x be 0. Replace x with 0, and solve the equation. This should give you the value of y. Using the example before: 3*0+4y=22, which becomes 4y=22, and then y=5½ You now have your first coordinate, (0 ; 5½)

steps.title: Let y be 0.
steps.content: Let y be 0. In the first equation, let y be 0 and solve the equation. This will give you the value of x. Using the example: 3x+4*0=22 which becomes 3x=22 which gives us the answer of x=7⅓ You now have a set of coordinates for your first line, (0 ; 5½) and (7⅓ ; 0)

steps.title: Draw a graph with 4 quadrants.
steps.content: Draw a graph with 4 quadrants. Draw the line of your first equation on it. [3] X Research source

steps.title: In the second equation, let x be 0.
steps.content: In the second equation, let x be 0. Then solve the equation, giving you the value of y. Using the example, it's 0+2y=2, which becomes 2y=2 and y=1 First coordinate is now (0 ; 1)

steps.title: Let y be 0.
steps.content: Let y be 0. Solve the equation and get the value of x. Example: x+2*0=2, which becomes x=2. Second coordinate is now (2 ; 0)

steps.title: Draw the line of the second equation on the same graph as before.
steps.content: Draw the line of the second equation on the same graph as before. If needed, increase the length of the 2 lines until they meet. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the point in which the 2 lines meet.
steps.content: Look at the point in which the 2 lines meet. Get it's coordinates (x ; y). The x coordinate will be the value of x in the equation, and the y coordinate will be the value of y! [5] X Research source If you've been using the example, the lines should meet at point (18 ; -8). x will be 18, and y will be -8!
